j:translation_en.text:
We are a global network of leading companies

Digitall is a global network of leading companies with a united focus on improving everyday living through ‘clean’ technology. Digitall's branded networks and numerous companies provide alternative energy, eco-friendly real estate, transportation and media. We also hold a diverse group of companies across numerous disciplines that are using digital technology to innovate their industries, including clean manufacturing, next generation fuels, healthcare innovations, invention prototyping and dry cleaning. We serve thousands of people every day in more than 20 countries around the world.

Expand

j:translation_de.text:
Digitall - Ein globales Netzwerk

Digitall ist ein globales Netzwerk von führenden Unternehmen mit einem einheitlichen Fokus auf der Verbesserung der Alltagsleben durch "saubere" Technologie. Digitalls Markennetze und zahlreichen Unternehmen bieten alternative Energien, Niedrigenergie- und Ökohäuser, umweltfreundliche Produkte und Null Emission Medien. Wir besitzen auch eine Vielzahl von Unternehmen in zahlreichen Branchen, die digitale Technologie verwenden, um ihre Branchen zu erneuern, einschließlich umweltfreundlicher Fertigung, Kraftstoffe der nächsten Generation, Innovationen im Gesundheitswesen und umweltfreundliche Patente zur chemischen Reinigung. Wir helfen jetzt schon Tausende von Menschen jeden Tag in mehr als 20 Ländern auf der ganzen Welt.

j:translation_fr.text:
Nous sommes un réseau mondial

Digitall est un réseau mondial de société leader avec pour focus l'amélioration de la vie quotidienne par l'usage des technologies "propre". Le réseau de sociétés opérant sous Digitall opèrent sur le marché des énergies alternatives, des habitations conforment aux exigences écologiques, des moyens de transports et des médias. Digitall possède également différentes sociétés opérant sur plusieurs domaines qui utilisent l'innovation digitale pour améliorer leur industrie respective comme, par exemple, les usines de fabrication, les combustibles de nouvelle génération, la santé, les prototype et le nettoyage. Nous adressons des milliers de personnes chaque jour dans plus de 20 pays à travers le monde.

Plus

j:translation_en.text:
People are at the heart of everything we do. As a result, we take our business personally and get involved with initiatives that are making the world a better place. Digitall is a Healthy Planet Advocate and develops green housing in local communities, as well as participating in the Food For Change, Clean Air Now and Healthy Families initiatives.

The future is in our hands starting right now. Whether we agree or not, technology IS the economy. Our lives depend on various technologies in nearly every aspect of our lives today. The generations who came before us, with a few notable exceptions like Galileo or Nikola Tesla, could have foreseen the role of technology in daily living. Likewise, we today are only seeing a small part of the potential that is waiting for us as the ‘new normal’ of tomorrow. Honing the leading edge of technology in every industry gives us an unparalleled advantage in living better today and tomorrow.

Too often the price of technology is a bigger carbon footprint, exhausting natural resources and leaving the most basic elements of humanity behind. When people at the end of life are asked about what really mattered, the answer is inevitably love, family, relationships and good health. Clean air, fresh water, healthy homes and families - these are the essentials of living well. We at Digitall are committed to helping you have more of it.

j:translation_fr.text:
Les gens sont au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Par conséquent, nous nous impliquons dans des initiatives qui font du monde un meilleur endroit. Digitall est un membre de “Healthy Planet Advocate" et développe des logement écologiques pour des communautés locales, de plus Digitall participe a Food For Change, Clean Air Now ainsi que initiatives Healthy Families.


L'avenir est entre nos mains à partir de maintenant. Que nous soyons d'accord ou non, la technologie EST l'économie. Nos vies dépendent quotidiennement de diverses technologies. Les générations qui nous ont précédés, avec quelques exceptions notables comme Galileo ou Nikola Tesla, n’auraient pas pu prévoir le rôle de la technologie dans la vie quotidienne. De même, nous ne voyons aujourd'hui seulement qu’une petite partie du potentiel de ce qui sera la «nouvelle normalité» de demain. Affuter la fine pointe de la haute technologie dans tous les secteurs nous donne un avantage sans précédent dans la vie d’aujourd'hui et de demain.


Trop souvent, le prix de la technologie est une plus grande empreinte carbone, épuisant les ressources naturelles et en laissant les éléments les plus fondamentaux de l'humanité derrière. Quand les gens à la fin de la vie sont interrogés sur ce qui compte, la réponse est inévitablement l'amour, la famille, les relations et la bonne santé. L'air pur, l'eau douce, les maisons et les familles en bonne santé - ce sont les éléments essentiels du bien vivre. Nous à Digitall nous engageons à vous aider à aller dans ce sens..

j:translation_en.description: Digitall’s global leadership in technology innovations for better living is furthered by the talented, intelligent, top minds in their industries. Our people design and deliver on big ideas worth exploring based on customer insights, behaviors and deep analytics.
j:translation_en.jcr:title: Our Companies

j:translation_de.description: Digitall's globale Führungsrolle in technologischen Innovationen im Bereich Lebensbedingungen, bildet die Voraussetzung für weltweiten wirtschaftlichen Wohlstand und bessere Lebensbedingungen der Menschen. Unsere Mitarbeiter entwickeln und schaffen immer die besten Ideen, wobei immer alle Kundenwünsche berücksichtigt werden.
j:translation_de.jcr:title: Unsere Marken

j:translation_fr.description: Les innovations technologiques de Digitall, dédiés à améliorer le quotidien, sont mis en oeuvre par les plus talenteux et brillants talents de l'industrie. Nos employés imaginent et délivrent à partir des les meilleurs idées, comportements, données et demandes de nos clients.
j:translation_fr.jcr:title: Nos Sociétés

j:translation_en.description: Bill Taylor, CFO (Chief Farming Officer) of the Organi-Food Network gave up being a stockbroker to become a farmer and then revolutionize the on-demand green grocery business. meet Bill
j:translation_en.jcr:title: Leading by Example

j:translation_de.description: Bill Taylor, CFO (Chief Farming Officer) der Bio-Nahrungsmittel Netzwerk gab seine Stelle als Börsenmakler auf, um Landwirt zu werden um dann das Grüne On-Demand Lebensmittelgeschäft zu revolutionieren.
j:translation_de.jcr:title: Mit gutem Beispiel voran

j:translation_fr.description: Bill Taylor, CFO (Chief Farming Officer) de notre réseau Bio-alimentaire, a abandonné son métier de trader pour devenir fermier et révolutionner l'épicerie Bio "à la demande". Allez à la rencontre de Bill.
j:translation_fr.jcr:title: Etre Exemplaire

j:translation_en.description: Digitall and our companies share the vision of investing in our people, preserving and living with the environment, and giving back to our local communities. For us, these are the keys to our culture and our collective future. We help people live better thanks to the passion and dedication of our people.
j:translation_en.jcr:title: People First

j:translation_de.description: Bei Digitall teilen alle die Vision, in die Mitarbeiter zu investieren, die Umwelt so zu gestalten, dass die Menschen im Einklang mit der Natur leben. Für uns ist dies der Schlüssel für die Erhaltung der Werte unserer gesamten natürlichen Umwelt. Wir helfen Menschen besser zu leben, dank der Leidenschaft und des Engagements unserer Mitarbeitern.
j:translation_de.jcr:title: Der Mensch im Mittelpunkt

j:translation_fr.description: Digitall et l'ensemble de ses filiales investissent sur les personnes, respectent et préservent l'environnement dans lequel elles opérèrent et redonnent en retour aux communautés locales avec lesquelles elles vivent. Pour nous, ceci est la fondation de notre culture et de notre futur collectif. Nous aidons les personnes à vivre mieux grâce à la passion et à l'implication de nos employés.
j:translation_fr.jcr:title: Les Personnes Avant Tout

j:translation_en.text: Digitall’s global network of companies gives us a unique perspective on the state of business today. To meet the needs of consumers in the market, it is vital to leverage technology both to optimize your people power and to reduce time to consumer for deliverables. Any company that does not heed the pace of business will be left behind. Even more, the economy is based on trust for sustainable relationships. We at Digitall stand behind our relationships with integrity, respect and loyalty. After all, every business transaction occurs from one human to another. We know our customers are individual people who are looking to solve their problems or meet a need - and we are there to support them in that moment. And we can help you to do that too.

j:translation_de.text: Digitall's globales Unternehmensnetzwerk verleiht uns eine einzigartige Geschäftsperspektive. Um den Bedürfnissen der Verbraucher gerecht zu werden, ist es unumgänglich, Technologie zu nutzen, um schnellere Leistungen zu erbringen und dabei die Arbeitskraft zu optimieren. Jedes Unternehmen, welches diese Tempo nicht mitgeht, wird es mittelfristig schwer haben. Angesichts der Tatsache, dass jede Geschäftsbeziehung Vertrauen für eine langfristige Beziehung benötigt, steht bei Digitall immer die Integrität, der Respekt und die Loyalität im Vordergrund. Bei jeder Geschäftsbeziehung steht deshalb der Mensch im Mittelpunkt. Den wir Wissen, dass jeder Kunde nur erfolgreich sein kann, wenn wir auch die individuellen Geschäftsvorgänge abbilden. Wir freuen uns, Ihnen helfen zu können.

j:translation_fr.text: Le réseau global de Digitall apporte une perspective unique sur l'état actuel de notre société. Afin de répondre à plus de clients sur nos marchés, il est vital de reposer sur la technologie pour accroitre la puissance des personne et réduire l'attente des clients. Toute société qui ne suit pas la vélocité du marché sera bloquée. D'autant que l'Economie est aujourd'hui basée sur des relations équitable. Digitall est fière de ses valeur d'intégrité de respect et de loyauté dans la mise en oeuvre de sa croissance. Les relations d'affaires reposent avant toutes choses sur les personnes. Nous avons conscience que nos clients sont des individus qui souhaitent que nous résolvions leurs problèmes ou répondions à un besoin - et nous sommes là pour les aider à ce moment précis. Et nous pouvons vous aider à faire de même.

j:translation_en.description:
This demonstration is configured with various users and roles to showcase the best practices on using Jahia DX 7.
You can learn more about these users and roles by clicking on the read more button below.
j:translation_en.jcr:title: How to Use This Demo

j:translation_de.description:
Für diese Demo-Version wurden verschiedene Anwender und Rollen konfiguriert, um Ihnen zu zeigen, wie Sie Jahia DX 7 nutzen.
Sie können mehr über die Anwender und Rollen erfahren, wenn Sie auf den „Mehr erfahren“-Button klicken.
j:translation_de.jcr:title: Wie Sie diese Demo

j:translation_fr.description:
Cette démonstration est configurée avec différents utilisateurs et rôles afin de présenter les bonnes pratiques d’utilisation de DX 7
Plus d’informations à propos de ces utilisateurs et rôles sont disponibles en cliquant sur le bouton ci-dessous
j:translation_fr.jcr:title: Comment utiliser cette démonstration

j:translation_en.text:
How to use this demonstration?

You can discover Jahia DX 7 using the following users (login / password):

  • root / root (if you're using the Demo Pack. Otherwise, the root password is the one set using the Jahia's installation tool): Server Administrator of this DX instance (with access to the full server administration interface including the Jahia Studio, if enabled during DX installation & setup).
  • bill / password: The Website Administrator with the same authoring features as the "Editor in Chief" but with an access to the website administration panel.
  • anne / password: The Editor in Chief with edit and contribute mode access to write and update the entire website and with access to personalization, page structure and content.
  • mathias / password: An Editor with access to the website "Edit Mode" interface, which provides additional authoring options than the "Contribute Mode".
  • jane / password: A Contributor with access to the contribute mode for simple content contribution.
  • irina / password: A content Reviewer, who will be in charge of content validation (1 step workflow).
  • jay / password: An authenticated Visitor on the website, who will be able to interact with website community tools like forum and blog.

j:translation_de.text:
So nutzen Sie diese Demo-Version

Sie können Jahia DX 7 mit folgenden Anwendern erkunden (Login/ Passwort):

  • root / root (Wenn Sie das spezifische Demo Pack nutzen. Ansonsten ist das Root-Passwort dasjenige, das gesetzt wird, wenn Sie das Jahia Installations-Tool verwenden.): Der Server-Administrator dieser DX Instanz (mit Zugriff auf die komplette Server-Administrationsoberfläche inklusive Jahia Studio, wenn dies während der Installation und dem Setup des DX so eingerichtet wurde)
  • bill / password: Der Website-Administrator, hat dieselben Redaktionsfunktionen wie der „Chefredakteur“, allerdings mit Zugriff auf den Administrationsbereich der Website.
  • anne / password: Die Chefredakteurin, hat Zugriff auf den Edit- und Contribute-Modus mit Schreib- und Änderungs-Berechtigung für die gesamte Website und Zugriff auf die Personalisierungsfunktionen, die Seitenstruktur und den Content.
  • mathias / password: Ein Redakteur, hat Zugriff auf die “Edit-Modus”-Oberfläche, die mehr Redaktionsmöglichkeiten bietet als der „Contribute-Modus“.
  • jane / password: Ein Contributor, hat Zugriff auf den „Contribute-Modus“ und kann einfachen Content erstellen.
  • irina / password: Eine Content-Prüferin, die die Richtigkeit des Contents prüft (einstufiger Workflow).
  • jay / password: Ein eingeloggter Besucher der Website, der die Berechtigung hat, mit den Community-Tools der Website wie etwa Forum und Blog zu interagieren.

j:translation_fr.text:
Comment utiliser cette démonstration ?

Vous pouvez découvrir DX 7 en naviguant dans ce site avec les profils suivants (login / mot de passe) :

  • root / root (si vous utilisez le package de démonstration, sinon le mot de passe du root est celui qui a été créé lors de l'utilisation de l'outil d'installation Jahia) : le super administrateur du serveur DX avec accès à l'interface d'administration complète du serveur et au Jahia Studio si ce dernier a été activé lors de l'installation et la configuration de votre instance DX
  • bill / password : "l'administrateur du site" avec accès à l'interface d'administration du site en plus des fonctionnalités autorisées pour "l'Editeur en chef".
  • anne / password : "l'Editeur en chef" du site qui peut accéder aux modes "Edition" et "Contribution", et qui de ce fait peut créer et modifier du contenu ainsi que la structure du site, des pages sur l'ensemble du site dont il peut également personnaliser l'accès.
  • mathias / password : un "éditeur" du site accédant à l'interface de gestion avancée "Edit Mode" diposant de fonctionnalités riche d'organisation et de personnalisation des contenus et du site.
  • jane / password : une "contributrice" au site accédant à une interface simple et efficace de création de contenu dans les sections qui lui sont autorisées.
  • irina / password : une "responsable de la validation" du contenu sur le site (workflow à 1 étape)
  • jay / password : un "visiteur" identifié pouvant de ce fait participer aux outils communautaires (blog, forum) présents sur le site.

j:translation_en.text: Simple text containing search-words for search tests: like popular is one of them, another one is 94105

j:translation_en.jcr:title: Apple’s MacBook Pro is too thin, and HP can prove it
j:translation_en.text:
Technology has been on a diet for years now. Whether we’re talking about notebooks, tablets, or smartphones, manufacturers seem convinced that the thinner a thing is, the better. The question is, what are we giving up when we give up girth?

In terms of notebook PCs, the MacBook Air was the first successful model to make thin and light the primary selling point. And that made sense — most notebooks at the time were indeed quite chunky. Windows notebooks quickly followed suit, with Intel’s Ultrabook initiative leading the way.

j:translation_en.jcr:title: 2017 CHEVROLET BOLT EV FIRST DRIVE
j:translation_en.secondaryTitle: Affordable, practical, and downright fun, Chevy’s Bolt is an EV for the everyman
j:translation_en.text:
20 years ago, electric vehicles lived on the fringe. Best suited for neighborhood or in-town commuting, these kooky, dawdling machines were either berated or ignored by the general public, driven almost exclusively by prosperous “influencers” from California. 10 years ago, EVs were on the rise. Their popularity and capability was increasing significantly, but they still existed outside the financial reaches of most. Tomorrow, battery-powered cars will be everywhere, they’ll be cheap, and they’ll be the norm.

 

Machine learning

j:translation_en.jcr:title: FACE YOUR FEARS WITH THE GEAR VR
j:translation_en.text: We asked four professionals who regularly scare others for a living to face their own fears in virtual reality, using the Samsung Gear VR, powered by Oculus.  A cop, a tattoo artist, a lawyer, and a dental hygienist were each subjected to Face Your Fears, a fully immersive 360 degree experience with four different terrifying scenarios. As they played through the game, each person reacted differently to what made their own hair stand on end

programming-languages.jcr:description: A programming language is a formal computer language designed to communicate instructions to a machine, particularly a computer. Programming languages can be used to create programs to control the behavior of a machine or to express algorithms.
programming-languages.jcr:title: Programming languages

history.text:
Early developments

The earliest computers were often programmed without the help of a programming language, by writing programs in absolute machine language. The programs, in decimal or binary form, were read in from punched cards or magnetic tape or toggled in on switches on the front panel of the computer. Absolute machine languages were later termed first-generation programming languages (1GL).

The next step was development of so-called second-generation programming languages (2GL) or assembly languages, which were still closely tied to the instruction set architecture of the specific computer. These served to make the program much more human-readable and relieved the programmer of tedious and error-prone address calculations.

proprietary-languages.jcr:title: Proprietary languages
proprietary-languages.text:
Although most of the most commonly used programming languages have fully open specifications and implementations, many programming languages exist only as proprietary programming languages with the implementation available only from a single vendor, which may claim that such a proprietary language is their intellectual property. Proprietary programming languages are commonly domain specific languages or internal scripting languages for a single product; some proprietary languages are used only internally within a vendor, while others are available to external users.

Some programming languages exist on the border between proprietary and open; for example, Oracle Corporation asserts proprietary rights to some aspects of the Java programming language, and Microsoft's C# programming language, which has open implementations of most parts of the system, also has Common Language Runtime (CLR) as a closed environment.

additional-comment-about-program.content: The earliest known programmable machine preceded the invention of the digital computer and is the automatic flute player described in the 9th century by the brothers Musa in Baghdad, "during the Islamic Golden Age".
additional-comment-about-program.jcr:title: Additional comment about programming languages

java.jcr:description: "Java language" redirects here. For the natural language from the Indonesian island of Java, see Javanese language. This article is about a programming language. For the software package downloaded from java.com, see Java SE. Not to be confused with JavaScript.

java-definition.jcr:title: Java definition
java-definition.text: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented,[14] and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. It is intended to let application developers "write once, run anywhere" (WORA),[15]meaning that compiled Java code can run on all platforms that support Java without the need for recompilation.[16] Java applications are typically compiled to bytecode that can run on any Java virtual machine (JVM) regardless of computer architecture. As of 2016, Java is one of the most popular programming languages in use,[17][18][19][20] particularly for client-server web applications, with a reported 9 million developers.[21] Java was originally developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems (which has since been acquired by Oracle Corporation) and released in 1995 as a core component of Sun Microsystems' Java platform. The language derives much of its syntax from C and C++, but it has fewer low-level facilities than either of them.

java-platform.jcr:title: Java platform
java-platform.text:
One design goal of Java is portability, which means that programs written for the Java platform must run similarly on any combination of hardware and operating system with adequate runtime support. This is achieved by compiling the Java language code to an intermediate representation called Java bytecode, instead of directly to architecture-specific machine code. Java bytecode instructions are analogous to machine code, but they are intended to be executed by a virtual machine (VM) written specifically for the host hardware. End users commonly use a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) installed on their own machine for standalone Java applications, or in a web browser for Java applets.

Standard libraries provide a generic way to access host-specific features such as graphics, threading, and networking.

The use of universal bytecode makes porting simple. However, the overhead of interpreting bytecode into machine instructions makes interpreted programs almost always run more slowly than native executables. However, just-in-time (JIT) compilers that compile bytecodes to machine code during runtime were introduced from an early stage. Java itself is platform-independent, and is adapted to the particular platform it is to run on by a Java virtual machine for it, which translates the Java bytecode into the platform's machine language.[39]

j:translation_en.desc: Originally invented in 1991 as a programming language for smart televisions, Oracle's Java is now the most popular language in the world — a position solidified by the fact that Java is crucial to Android app development and lots of business software.

This language for programming web sites is incredibly common — some estimates say it powers one-third of the web. Big sites like WordPress, Facebook, and Yahoo use it. A lot of programmers also hate PHP with a passion — Stack Exchange founder Jeff Atwood once wrote "PHP isn't so much a language as a random collection of arbitrary stuff, a virtual explosion at the keyword and function factory."

Originally developed by a NASA engineer in the late eighties, Perl excels at processing text, and developers like it because it's powerful and flexible. It was once famously described as "the duct tape of the web," because it's really great at holding websites together, but it's not the most elegant language.

j:translation_fr.jcr:title: Le réseau all-Organic Foods remporte un nouveau partenariat

j:translation_de.desc: all-Organic Foods Network, Bio-Lebensmittel-Netzwerk, erreicht langsam aber stetig einen immer höheren Bekanntheitsgrad. Wir freuen uns, Greater Parents’ Council of Happytown als neuen Sponsor gewonnen zu haben. Auf die Frage, warum Greater Parents’ Council of Happytown, nun als offizieller Sponsor, all-Organic Foods Network fördert, antwortete Greater Parents’ Council Sprecher: "Essen ist Lust. Essen ist Genuss. Essen soll das Wohlbefinden von Kindern stärken, Spaß machen und alle Sinne ansprechen. Gesundes vollwertiges Essen soll die Gesundheit erhalten. "Seit der Erfindung der Kochkunst essen die Menschen doppelt soviel, wie die Natur verlangt." - Benjamin Franklin Durch das Sponsering wir die all-Organic Foods Network ihren Bekanntheitsgrad dazu nutzen, weitere Märkte erschließen und weitere glückliche Kunden zu gewinnen. "Die Qualität deiner Nahrungsmittel bestimmt die Qualität deines Lebens." ~ Bill Taylor, CEO von all-Organic Foods Network
j:translation_de.jcr:title: All-Organic findet einen weiteren Sponsor

j:translation_de.desc: all-Movies, ein Medien- und Unterhaltungsunternehmen, und vertreibt eine Bibliothek von über 50 neue Urlaubsfilme. Zu den kommenden Kinofilmen gehören die internationalen Produktionen "Santa’s Son Comes Home" mit John Doe und Jane Roberts und "The Day The Rock Broke Santa’s Knee" nach dem Weltbestseller von Jim Schutterhand. Mit dem neuen Filmen ist all-Movies das einzige Unternehmen , das seine Filme in den weltweit im Kinos ausstrahlt. Neben große Hollywood-Produktionen, wird auch für anspruchsvolles Kino produziert. In Kanada finden derzeit die Dreharbeiten zu Jeres Penos Verfilmung "Über den Dächern von Paris" statt. In den kommenden Wochen finden die Dreharbeiten noch in China und der Schweiz statt. Der weltweite Kinostart soll gegen Ende des kommendes Jahres erfolgen.

j:translation_de.desc: Nach all-Movies, ein Medien- und Unterhaltungsunternehmen, gibt es neue Forschungsergebnisse, die nahelegen, dass das sogenanntes Brainfood einen positiven Einfluss auf das Gehirn besitzt. Erfolg kann vorhergesagt werden, abhängig von den Filmen, welcher ein Mensch über seine Leben hinweg schaut. Zum Beispiel findet man bei Horrorfilm Liebhaber im Vergleich zu Romantik Filmliebhaber höherer Stresshormone im Körpersystem. Und kommen wir nun zur wichtigsten Frage: Was schauen Sie den gerne? Und was werden Sie als nächstes sich anschauen?

all-about.jcr:description:
Perl is a family of high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages. The languages in this family include Perl 5 and Perl 6.[7]
Though Perl is not officially an acronym,[8] there are various backronyms in use, the best-known being "Practical Extraction and Reporting Language".[9] Perl was originally developed by Larry Wall in 1987 as a general-purpose Unix scripting language to make report processing easier.[10] Since then, it has undergone many changes and revisions. Perl 6, which began as a redesign of Perl 5 in 2000, eventually evolved into a separate language. Both languages continue to be developed independently by different development teams and liberally borrow ideas from one another.
The Perl languages borrow features from other programming languages including C, shell script (sh), AWK, and sed.[11] They provide powerful text processing facilities without the arbitrary data-length limits of many contemporary Unix commandline tools,[12] facilitating easy manipulation of text files. Perl 5 gained widespread popularity in the late 1990s as a CGI scripting language, in part due to its unsurpassed[13][14][15] regular expression and string parsing abilities.[16]
all-about.jcr:title: All about

history.content:
Early versions[edit]

Larry Wall began work on Perl in 1987, while working as a programmer at Unisys,[12] and released version 1.0 to the comp.sources.misc newsgroup on December 18, 1987.[20] The language expanded rapidly over the next few years.

Perl 2, released in 1988, featured a better regular expression engine. Perl 3, released in 1989, added support for binary data streams.

Originally, the only documentation for Perl was a single (increasingly lengthy) man page. In 1991, Programming Perl, known to many Perl programmers as the "Camel Book" because of its cover, was published and became the de facto reference for the language. At the same time, the Perl version number was bumped to 4, not to mark a major change in the language but to identify the version that was well documented by the book.

Early Perl 5[edit]

Main article: Perl 5 version history

Perl 4 went through a series of maintenance releases, culminating in Perl 4.036 in 1993. At that point, Wall abandoned Perl 4 to begin work on Perl 5. Initial design of Perl 5 continued into 1994. The perl5-porters mailing list was established in May 1994 to coordinate work on porting Perl 5 to different platforms. It remains the primary forum for development, maintenance, and porting of Perl 5.[21]

Perl 5.000 was released on October 17, 1994.[22] It was a nearly complete rewrite of the interpreter, and it added many new features to the language, including objects, references, lexical (my) variables, and modules. Importantly, modules provided a mechanism for extending the language without modifying the interpreter. This allowed the core interpreter to stabilize, even as it enabled ordinary Perl programmers to add new language features. Perl 5 has been in active development since then.

ponie.content:
PONIE is an acronym for Perl On New Internal Engine. The PONIE Project existed from 2003 until 2006 and was to be a bridge between Perl 5 and Perl 6. It was an effort to rewrite the Perl 5 interpreter to run on Parrot, the Perl 6 virtual machine. The goal was to ensure the future of the millions of lines of Perl 5 code at thousands of companies around the world.[50]

The PONIE project ended in 2006 and is no longer being actively developed. Some of the improvements made to the Perl 5 interpreter as part of PONIE were folded into that project.[51]

re-history.content: Wanted to reply to this article... since documentation is most important...
re-history.jcr:title: Re: History

availability.content:
Perl is dual licensed under both the Artistic License 1.0[4][5] and the GNU General Public License.[6] Distributions are available for most operating systems. It is particularly prevalent on Unix and Unix-like systems, but it has been ported to most modern (and many obsolete) platforms. With only six reported exceptions, Perl can be compiled from source code on all POSIX-compliant, or otherwise-Unix-compatible platforms.[76]

Because of unusual changes required for the classic Mac OS environment, a special port called MacPerl was shipped independently.[77]

The Comprehensive Perl Archive Network carries a complete list of supported platforms with links to the distributions available on each.[78] CPAN is also the source for publicly available Perl modules that are not part of the core Perl distribution.

function-and-target.content:
Function and target
A computer programming language is a language used to write computer programs, which involve a computer performing some kind of computation[5] or algorithm and possibly control external devices such as printers, disk drives, robots,[6] and so on. For example, PostScript programs are frequently created by another program to control a computer printer or display. More generally, a programming language may describe computation on some, possibly abstract, machine. It is generally accepted that a complete specification for a programming language includes a description, possibly idealized, of a machine or processor for that language.[7] In most practical contexts, a programming language involves a computer; consequently, programming languages are usually defined and studied this way.[8] Programming languages differ from natural languages in that natural languages are only used for interaction between people, while programming languages also allow humans to communicate instructions to machines.
function-and-target.jcr:title: Function and Target

re-function-and-target.content: Perl is a family of high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages. The languages in this family include Perl 5 and Perl 6.[7]
re-function-and-target.jcr:title: Re: Function and Target

all-about-php.jcr:description: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed primarily for web development but also used as a general-purpose programming language
all-about-php.jcr:title: All about php

history.content:
PHP development began in 1995 when Rasmus Lerdorf wrote several Common Gateway Interface (CGI) programs in C,[11][12][13]which he used to maintain his personal homepage. He extended them to work with web forms and to communicate with databases, and called this implementation "Personal Home Page/Forms Interpreter" or PHP/FI.

PHP/FI could help to build simple, dynamic web applications. To accelerate bug reporting and to improve the code, Lerdorf initially announced the release of PHP/FI as "Personal Home Page Tools (PHP Tools) version 1.0" on the Usenet discussion group comp.infosystems.www.authoring.cgi on June 8, 1995.[14][15] This release already had the basic functionality that PHP has as of 2013. This included Perl-like variables, form handling, and the ability to embed HTML. The syntax resembled that of Perl but was simpler, more limited and less consistent.[6]

security.content: In 2013, 9% of all vulnerabilities listed by the National Vulnerability Database were linked to PHP;[181] historically, about 30% of all vulnerabilities listed since 1996 in this database are linked to PHP. Technical security flaws of the language itself or of its core libraries are not frequent; (these numbered 22 in 2009, which was about 1% of the total, although PHP applies to about 20% of programs listed.)[182] Recognizing that programmers make mistakes, some languages include taint checking to automatically detect the lack of input validation which induces many issues. Such a feature is being developed for PHP,[183] but its inclusion into a release has been rejected several times in the past.[184][185]

re-security.content:
In 2013, 9% of all vulnerabilities listed by the National Vulnerability Database were linked to PHP;[181] historically, about 30% of all vulnerabilities listed since 1996 in this database are linked to PHP. Technical security flaws of the language itself or of its core libraries are not frequent; (these numbered 22 in 2009, which was about 1% of the total, although PHP applies to about 20% of programs listed.)[182] Recognizing that programmers make mistakes, some languages include taint checking to automatically detect the lack of input validation which induces many issues. Such a feature is being developed for PHP,[183] but its inclusion into a release has been rejected several times in the past.[184][185]

 

Security programming language php
re-security.jcr:title: Re: Security

usage.content: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to server-side web development, in which case PHP generally runs on a web server. Any PHP code in a requested file is executed by the PHP runtime, usually to create dynamic web page content or dynamic images used on websites or elsewhere.[146] It can also be used for command-line scripting and client-side graphical user interface (GUI) applications. PHP can be deployed on most web servers, many operating systems and platforms, and can be used with many relational database management systems (RDBMS). Most web hosting providers support PHP for use by their clients. It is available free of charge, and the PHP Group provides the complete source code for users to build, customize and extend for their own use.

all-about-java.jcr:description: Java language" redirects here. For the natural language from the Indonesian island of Java, see Javanese language. This article is about a programming language. For the software package downloaded from java.com, see Java SE. Not to be confused with JavaScript.
all-about-java.jcr:title: All about java

history.content: James Gosling, Mike Sheridan, and Patrick Naughton initiated the Java language project in June 1991.[22] Java was originally designed for interactive television, but it was too advanced for the digital cable television industry at the time.[23] The language was initially called Oak after an oak tree that stood outside Gosling's office. Later the project went by the name Green and was finally renamed Java, from Java coffee.[24] Gosling designed Java with a C/C++-style syntax that system and application programmers would find familiar.[25]

j:translation_en.jcr:title: 7 Technology Trends That Will Dominate 2017
j:translation_en.secondaryTitle: Technology Trends - There’s always something new on the horizon
j:translation_en.text: There’s always something new on the horizon, and we can’t help but wait and wonder what technological marvels are coming next.

j:translation_en.jcr:title: IoT and Smart Home Tech
j:translation_en.secondaryTitle: Technology Trends - There’s always something new on the horizon.
j:translation_en.text: We’ve been hearing about the forthcoming revolution of the Internet-of-Things (IoT) and resulting interconnectedness of smart home technology for years. So what’s the holdup? Why aren’t we all living in smart, connected homes by now? Part of the problem is too much competition, with not enough collaboration—there are tons of individual appliances and apps on the market, but few solutions to tie every ...

j:translation_en.jcr:title: AR and VR
j:translation_en.secondaryTitle: Technology Trends - There’s always something new on the horizon
j:translation_en.text: We’ve already seen some major steps forward for augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) technology in 2016. Oculus Rift was released, to positive reception, and thousands of VR apps and games followed. We also saw Pokémon Go, an AR game, explode with over 100 million downloads. The market is ready for AR and VR, and we’ve already got some early-stage devices and tech for these applications, but it’s going to be next year before we see things really take off. Once they do, you’ll need to be ready for AR and VR versions of practically everything — and ample marketing opportunities to follow.
